info.title: pagoPA Mocker Configurator
info.description: A service that permits to configure the mocked responses used by Mocker service

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of elements to be included in the page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The index of the page, starting from 0.

delete.summary: Delete all existing archetypes by criteria

file.description: JSON file containing the OpenAPI to analyze

parameters.description: The identifier related to the mock rule

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: This header identifies the call, if not passed it is self-generated. This ID is returned in the response.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the script, used as a search filter.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: This header identifies the call, if not passed it is self-generated. This ID is returned in the response.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mock condition.

order.description: The cardinal order on which the mock condition will be evaluated by Mocker.

field_position.description: The parameter that define where the field/element that will be evaluated by this condition is located in the request.

analyzed_content_type.description: The parameter that define the type of the source in the request where the field/element that will be evaluated by this condition will be extracted.

field_name.description: The parameter that define the identifier of the field/element that will be evaluated by this condition

condition_type.description: The parameter that define the type of condition that will be applied on the field/element that will be evaluated.

condition_value.description: The parameter that define the value that the field/element must respect following the condition type.

MockCondition.description: The condition applied to the mock rule that a request must respect in order to retrieve the mocked response related to the rule.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mock resource.

name.description: The name or description related to the mock resources, for human readability.

subsystem.description: The URL section that define the subsystem on which the mock resource is related.

resource_url.description: The specific URL on which the mock resource will be defined for the subsystem. If no specific URL is needed, use blank string.

http_method.description: The HTTP method related to the mock resource.

special_headers.description: The special headers that can be added to a request in order to better reference a mock resource.

is_active.description: The status flag that permits to activate or not the mock resource for Mocker evaluation.

tags.description: The set of tags on which the mock resource is related to.

items.description: The set of tags on which the mock resource is related to.

rules.description: The list of rules related to the mock resource that will be evaluated by the Mocker.

MockResource.description: The mock resource, analyzed by Mocker, that permits to generate different responses based by rules and conditions.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mock response

body.description: The response body in Base64 format related to the mock response.

status.description: The HTTP response status related to the mock response.

headers.description: The list of header to be set to mock response.

injected_parameters.description: The list of parameters that will be injected from request body to response body by Mocker.

items.description: The list of parameters that will be injected from request body to response body by Mocker.

MockResponse.description: The mocked response that will be generated by Mocker if the rule condition are all verified.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mock rule

name.description: The name or description related to the mock rule, for human readability.

order.description: The cardinal order on which the mock role will be evaluated by Mocker.

is_active.description: The status flag that permits to activate or not the mock rule for Mocker evaluation.

tags.description: The set of tags on which the mock rule is related to.

items.description: The set of tags on which the mock rule is related to.

conditions.description: The list of condition related to the mock rule that will be evaluated in AND by the Mocker.

MockRule.description: The rule a passed request can follow in order to obtain the defined mocked response.

script_name.description: The name of the script that will be executed by the Mocker for the associated rule.

description.description: The human-readable description that explains the behavior of the script.

is_active.description: The flag that define if the scripting process is enabled for the associated rule.

input_parameters.description: The list of parameters to be set as input for the execution of the script in the Mocker.

output_parameters.description: The list of parameters that will be returned as output from the script during runtime.

items.description: The list of parameters that will be returned as output from the script during runtime.

MockScripting.description: The information about the script to be executed by Mocker if all the conditions occurs.

name.description: The key of the header to be set to mock response by Mocker.

value.description: The value of the header to be set to mock response by Mocker.

ResponseHeader.description: The header that will be set to a mocked response

name.description: The name of the parameter to be set as input. In script, it will be retrieved wit the annotation parameters.FIELD_NAME.

value.description: The value of the parameter to be set as input. The value can be a constant or a dynamic value, retrievable from request body.

ScriptParameter.description: The parameter to be set as input for the execution of the script in the Mocker.

name.description: The key of the special header to be set to request to retrieve mock response from Mocker.

value.description: The value of the special header to be set to request to retrieve mock response from Mocker.

SpecialRequestHeader.description: The special header that can be added to a request in order to better reference a mock resource.

title.description: A short, summary of the problem type. Written in english and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized); example: Service Unavailable

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: There was an error processing the request

name.description: The name or description related to the mock resources, for human readability.

is_active.description: The status flag that permits to activate or not the mock resource for Mocker evaluation.

tags.description: The set of tags on which the mock resource is related to.

items.description: The set of tags on which the mock resource is related to.

MockResourceGeneralInfo.description: The general information about mock resource, used for partial update.

id.description: The unique identifier of the archetype.

name.description: The name or description related to the archetype, for human readability.

subsystem.description: The URL section that define the subsystem on which the archetype is related.

resource_url.description: The specific URL on which the archetype will be defined for the subsystem.

http_method.description: The HTTP method related to the archetype.

tags.description: The set of tags on which the archetype is related to.

items.description: The set of tags on which the archetype is related to.

url_parameters.description: The list of parameter related to the archetype URL that must be set in mock resource creation.

items.description: The list of parameter related to the archetype URL that must be set in mock resource creation.

responses.description: The list of responses related to the archetype that can be edited in mock resource creation.

id.description: The unique identifier of the archetype response.

ArchetypeResponse.description: The list of responses related to the archetype that can be edited in mock resource creation.

name.description: The key of the header to be set to archetype.

value.description: The value of the header to be set to archetype.

ArchetypeResponseHeader.description: The header that will be set to a mocked response generated by the archetype

id.description: The unique identifier of the script.

description.description: The human-readable description that explains the behavior of the script.

input_parameters.description: The list of parameters to be passed as input to the script during runtime.

items.description: The list of parameters to be passed as input to the script during runtime.

output_parameters.description: The list of parameters that will be returned as output from the script during runtime.

items.description: The list of parameters that will be returned as output from the script during runtime.

ScriptMetadata.description: The script that can be executed by Mocker and that permits to generate dynamic values based on scripted execution.

ScriptMetadataList.description: The complete list of scripts to be used for dynamic mock behavior.

resources.description: The list of retrieved mock resources.

MockResourceList.description: The paginated list of mock resources.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mock resource.

name.description: The name or description related to the mock resources, for human readability.

subsystem.description: The URL section that define the subsystem on which the mock resource is related.

resource_url.description: The specific URL on which the mock resource will be defined for the subsystem. If no specific URL is needed, use blank string.

http_method.description: The HTTP method related to the mock resource.

special_headers.description: The special headers that can be added to a request in order to better reference a mock resource.

is_active.description: The status flag that permits to activate or not the mock resource for Mocker evaluation.

tags.description: The set of tags on which the mock resource is related to.

items.description: The set of tags on which the mock resource is related to.

limit.description: Required number of items per page

items_found.description: Number of items found. (The last page may have fewer elements than required)

total_items.description: Total number of items for all pages

PageInfo.description: The information related to the result page.

version.description: The version related to the installed application.

environment.description: The environment tag on which the application is installed.

db_connection.description: The status related to the database connection.

ApiKey.description: The API key to access this function app.
ApiKey.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key

Authorization.description: JWT token get after Azure Login
